text: Randy Wayne Schekman (born December 30, 1948) is an American cell biologist. He works at the University of California, Berkeley. He is the editor-in-chief of Proceedings of the National Academy of Sciences and Annual Review of Cell and Developmental Biology. He was elected to the National Academy of Sciences in 1992. He won the 2013 Nobel Prize for Physiology or Medicine with James Rothman and Thomas C. SÃ¼dhof for their work on cell membrane vesicle trafficking. ==References== Category:1948 births Category:Living people Category:American biologists Category:Scientists from Minnesota Category:People from Saint Paul, Minnesota
title: Randy Schekman
